Common definition of prime number: a number whose only factors are 1 and itself; a number, larger than 1, that can only be divided evenly by itself and 1; a positive integer greater than 1 that can only be divided by itself and 1 without leaving a remainder, with 1 often excluded."}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"That being said, how is it possible to have prime numbers if 0 is the "third multiple" of every one of them? Inadequate.)"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The original poster used trays of avocados to argue that zero is a multiple of 3. That clearly indicated two things to me: 1) that the author had confused multiple and divisibility, and 2) that the topic under discussion was NOT at a postgraduate level of mathematics."}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The common definition of multiple is as I gave it in a previous response, and I found an online math dictionary which agreed (which I hadn't checked before), in addition to my own 30+ years of teaching math at the level of the original question posed (using many textbooks at that level)."}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In all common usage of multiple, at the level indicated by the original question and its justification, negatives, fractions, decimals, and zero are not considered multiples of any counting numbers."}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For other purposes, the definition can likely be tortured to barely resemble the original meaning, as some of the other posters and you have shown."}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"But zero is NOT a multiple of 3, at any level of grade school or high school math - the level at which a tray of avocados would be used to illustrate."}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thank you for your condescension, but I assure you it is unneeded. If that is representative of the commentary here, perhaps I'll satisfy my math jones elsewhere. Peace."}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(Incidentally, you can't use a tray of avocados to illustrate -3 as a multiple of 3.) "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}
